guiSET.core

Class ContextMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • guiSET.core.Control
      • guiSET.core.TextBased
        • guiSET.core.MenuItem
          • guiSET.core.ContextMenu

  • public class ContextMenu
extends MenuItem
    Create a tool/menu strip outside the main menu (i.e. for dropdown menus) that opens upon an action such as rightclick. A ContextMenu does not need to (and should not) be added to a container or anything. The dropdown can be shown/hidden width the show() and hide() methods. The position is automatically set to the current mouse position.
    Author:
    Mc-Zen
